newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian castor bounces back on speculative buying.
newsitem.headline: Indian castor bounces back on speculative buying.

text.p: Castorseed June delivery bounced back from the reduced level to move up from 1,114/1,115 rupees to 1,119/1,120 rupees per quintal on renewed speculative buying on Friday, dealers said.
"Overseas buying remained slow but short covering by bears at the lower level helped prices bounce back," one dealer said.
Technically the market is oversold and fresh short covering may drag prices upward, traders said.
Groundnut oil slid from 366/367 rupees to 364/365 rupees per 10 kg on sluggish physical buying. Reports of arrivals of the summer crop prompted unloading by local stockists.
"Imported palm-oil also slid by 1/2 rupees at 291/292 rupees per 10 kgs in line with the slide in prices of groundnut oil," one broker said.
In Rajkot spot groundnut oil was quoted 5/10 rupees lower at 560/565 rupees per 15 kg on the back of summer crop arrivals.
"These arrivals will pick up in the coming days and prices will move down gradually," said Praful Modi, a leading dealer.
